com.illcode.hl7

Class Segment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.illcode.hl7.Segment

  • public final class Segment
extends java.lang.Object
    Field data in a single HL7v2 segment.

      • Segment

        public Segment(java.lang.String id,
       java.util.List<java.util.List<Segment.FieldValue>> fieldValues)
        Construct a segment with the given ID and list of field values.
        Parameters:
        id - segment ID
        fieldValues - a list of list of field values. The outer list index represents the field #, and the inner list index represents the field repetitions.

      • Segment

        public Segment(java.lang.String id,
       int sizeHint)
        Construct an empty segment with a hint about its final size.
        Parameters:
        id - segment ID
        sizeHint - hint as to the total number of fields for which we should allocate our internal data structures

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Get the ID of this segment (ex. "MSH")

      • getFieldValue

        public java.lang.String getFieldValue(int fieldNo,
                             int repetition,
                             int componentNo,
                             int subcomponentNo)
        Return the string value of a given field/component/subcomponent, or the empty string ("") if the requested value does not exist, or is a null value. Requesting the first child of a scalar parent will return the value of the parent. Requesting the value of a parent that is a composite will return the value of its first child.

        All parameters represent indices that start at 1.

        Parameters:
        fieldNo - field number (>= 1)
        repetition - the repetition number, for fields that have repeated values (>= 1)
        componentNo - component number (or 0, to indicate no component)
        subcomponentNo - subcomponent number (or 0, to indicate no subcomponent)
        Returns:
        value of field/repetition/component/subcomponent, or empty string

      • getFieldValue

        public java.lang.String getFieldValue(int fieldNo)
        Equivalent to getFieldValue(fieldNo, 1, 0, 0).

      • putFieldValues

        public void putFieldValues(int fieldNo,
                  java.util.List<Segment.FieldValue> repeatedFieldValues)
        Add or replace values for a field.
        Parameters:
        fieldNo - field number (>= 1)
        repeatedFieldValues - list of repetitions of field values; a null value clears the field

      • clearFieldValues

        public void clearFieldValues(int fieldNo)
        Clear any values from a given field
        Parameters:
        fieldNo - field number (>= 1)

      • addFieldValue

        public void addFieldValue(int fieldNo,
                 Segment.FieldValue v)
        Add a value to a given field. If a value is already present in the specified field, the new value will be added as a repetition.
        Parameters:
        fieldNo - field number (>= 1)
        v - field value to add

      • addFieldValue

        public void addFieldValue(int fieldNo,
                 java.lang.String value)
        Add a scalar value to a given field. If a value is already present in the specified field, the new value will be added as a repetition.
        Parameters:
        fieldNo - field number (>= 1)
        value - scalar field value to add

      • setFieldValue

        public void setFieldValue(int fieldNo,
                 int repetition,
                 int componentNo,
                 int subcomponentNo,
                 java.lang.String value)
        Set the scalar value for a specified field/repetition/component/subcomponent. Any existing value will be replaced, and if a scalar value exists at a point where a composite value is needed, the scalar will be replaced (for instance, if you set the value for "PID.3.2" but "PID.3" is a scalar, the scalar value will be replaced by a composite with a null "PID.3.1" and the given value of "PID.3.2").
        Parameters:
        fieldNo - field number (>= 1)
        repetition - the repetition number, for fields that have repeated values (>= 1)
        componentNo - component number (or 0, to indicate no component)
        subcomponentNo - subcomponent number (or 0, to indicate no subcomponent)
        value - scalar value to set

      • setFieldValue

        public void setFieldValue(int fieldNo,
                 java.lang.String value)
        Equivalent to setFieldValue(fieldNo, 1, 0, 0, value).

      • setFieldValue

        public void setFieldValue(int fieldNo,
                 int componentNo,

        Equivalent to setFieldValue(fieldNo, 1, componentNo, 0, value).
